ground_truth: He smiles at Frodo as Frodo sits up, looking at Gandalf questioningly, troubled, and his eyes drift away. Saruman stands over Gandalf, gloating. With the power of his staff, Saruman raises Gandalf from the ground, then sends him crashing to the floor. Suddenly, Gandalf lurches to his feet and throws himself off the tower. Saruman watches Gandalf fly away from Isengard on the back of a giant eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle soars majestically over the mountains, carrying Gandalf towards the dawn. Frodo raises himself up and looks at Gandalf as Sam runs to Frodo's bedside, overjoyed to find Frodo awake. Sam looks past Frodo smiling at a bent figure sitting alone on a bench in the sun. Frodo turns, following Sam's gaze to Bilbo Baggins, breaking into a broad grin as Frodo rushes forward to embrace him. Bilbo has aged significantly since last seen. Frodo turns the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather bound journal, looking at page after page of beautiful handwriting, with intricate maps and drawings. He is sitting with Frodo on a terrace overlooking a waterfall. Frodo turns a page and finds a map of the Shire, as Bilbo smiles proudly. Sam busily tries to stuff more things into his already full pack, pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes, and then looks up, startled. Gandalf and Elrond watch Frodo and Sam from Elrond's balcony before Elrond turns and walks away and Gandalf turns to look out the window. With the broken sword, Isildur slices off Sauron's finger as Elrond reacts and Isildur turns and walks away. Strider watches from the shadows as Boromir strolls through the darkened gallery, his eyes drawn to an old fresco on the wall depicting Isildur defeating Sauron. Boromir looks with wonderment at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, lying on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing Strider's presence, looks from the blade to Strider, as if sensing a connection. Night falls upon the beautiful valley of Rivendell, still and quiet, as Strider and Arwen stand upon a stone bridge, the Evenstar at Arwen's breast shining in the moonlight. Arwen looks into Strider's eyes, closes Strider's fingers around the jewel, and leans towards him, gently kissing him. Elrond addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middle-earth, with Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and 20 other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo steps forward, moves towards a stone plinth, places the ring on the plinth, and returns to his seat. Strider says nothing as Boromir turns away dismissively, then sharply as Legolas stands and Frodo looks at Strider questioningly.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He grins at Frodo as Frodo rises up, gazing at Gandalf inquisitively, perturbed, and his eyes wander away. Saruman looms over Gandalf, exulting. With the might of his staff, Saruman lifts Gandalf from the earth, then hurls him crashing to the ground. Suddenly, Gandalf staggers to his feet and hurls himself off the turret. Saruman observes Gandalf soar away from Isengard on the back of a colossal eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle ascends grandly over the peaks, bearing Gandalf towards the dawn. Frodo elevates himself up and gazes at Gandalf as Sam races to Frodo's bedside, elated to find Frodo conscious. Sam gazes past Frodo grinning at a bent figure seated alone on a bench in the sun. Frodo turns, following Sam's glance to Bilbo Baggins, breaking into a wide grin as Frodo dashes forward to hug him. Bilbo has aged considerably since last seen. Frodo turns the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather bound journal, gazing at page after page of exquisite penmanship, with elaborate maps and illustrations. He is seated with Frodo on a terrace overlooking a cascade. Frodo turns a page and discovers a map of the Shire, as Bilbo grins proudly. Sam busily tries to cram more items into his already full pack, pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes, and then gazes up, startled. Gandalf and Elrond observe Frodo and Sam from Elrond's balcony before Elrond turns and strides away and Gandalf turns to gaze out the window. With the shattered sword, Isildur severs off Sauron's digit as Elrond reacts and Isildur turns and strides away. Strider observes from the shadows as Boromir saunters through the darkened gallery, his eyes drawn to an ancient fresco on the wall depicting Isildur vanquishing Sauron. Boromir gazes with amazement at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, lying on a cloth-covered pedestal, and sensing Strider's presence, gazes from the blade to Strider, as if perceiving a connection. Night descends upon the lovely vale of Rivendell, still and silent, as Strider and Arwen stand upon a stone span, the Evenstar at Arwen's breast shining in the moonlight. Arwen gazes into Strider's eyes, closes Strider's fingers around the gem, and leans towards him, tenderly kissing him. Elrond addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middle-earth, with Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and 20 other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo steps forward, advances towards a stone pedestal, places the ring on the pedestal, and returns to his seat. Strider says nothing as Boromir turns away dismissively, then sharply as Legolas stands and Frodo gazes at Strider inquisitively.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Frodo is smiled at by him as Frodo sits up, looking at Gandalf questioningly, troubled, and away drift his eyes. Gandalf is stood over by Saruman, gloating. With the power of his staff, Gandalf is raised from the ground by Saruman, then he is sent crashing to the floor by him. Suddenly, Gandalf lurches to his feet and throws himself off the tower. Gandalf is watched by Saruman as he flies away from Isengard on the back of a giant eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle soars majestically over the mountains, carrying Gandalf towards the dawn. Frodo is raised up by himself and Gandalf is looked at by him as Sam runs to Frodo's bedside, overjoyed to find Frodo awake. Sam looks past Frodo, smiling at a bent figure who sits alone on a bench in the sun. Sam's gaze is followed by Frodo as he turns to Bilbo Baggins, breaking into a broad grin as Bilbo is rushed forward to be embraced by Frodo. He has aged significantly since Bilbo was last seen. The neatly inscribed title page of a red leather-bound journal is turned by Frodo as he looks at page after page of beautiful handwriting, with intricate maps and drawings. Frodo is sitting with him on a terrace overlooking a waterfall. A page is turned by Frodo and he finds a map of the Shire, as Bilbo smiles proudly. More things are busily tried to be stuffed into his already full pack by Sam, pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes, and then Sam is looked up and startled. Frodo and Sam are watched by Gandalf and Elrond from Elrond's balcony before Elrond turns and walks away and Gandalf turns to look out the window. With the broken sword, Sauron's finger is sliced off by Isildur as Elrond reacts and Isildur turns and walks away. Strider watches from the shadows as the darkened gallery is strolled through by Boromir, his eyes drawn to an old fresco on the wall depicting Isildur defeating Sauron. With wonderment, Boromir looks at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, lying on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing Strider's presence, Boromir looks from the blade to Strider, as if sensing a connection. The beautiful valley of Rivendell is fallen upon by night, still and quiet, as a stone bridge is stood upon by Strider and Arwen, the Evenstar at Arwen's breast shining in the moonlight. Into Strider's eyes, Arwen looks, Strider's fingers are closed around the jewel by her, and she leans towards him, gently kissing him. Elrond addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middle-earth, with Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and 20 other elves, dwarves, and men. Forward steps Frodo, he moves towards a stone plinth, places the ring on the plinth, and then his seat is returned to by him. Nothing is said by Strider as Boromir turns away dismissively, then sharply as Legolas stands and Strider is looked at questioningly by Frodo.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Frodo sits up, looking questioningly at Gandalf, who smiles at him. Saruman stands over Gandalf, gloating, and uses his staff to raise Gandalf before crashing him to the floor. Gandalf suddenly leaps up and throws himself off the tower, flying away from Isengard on Gwaihir the Eagle. The eagle soars over mountains, carrying Gandalf toward dawn. Frodo, awake, sees Gandalf as Sam joyfully runs to his bedside. Sam notices a figure on a bench in the sun—Bilbo Baggins. Frodo grins and rushes to embrace the significantly aged Bilbo. Frodo turns the title page of a red leather journal, admiring the handwriting, maps, and drawings while sitting with Bilbo on a terrace overlooking a waterfall. He finds a map of the Shire as Bilbo smiles. Sam stuffs more items into his full pack, then looks up, startled. Gandalf and Elrond watch Frodo and Sam from a balcony before Elrond departs. Isildur slices off Sauron's finger with a broken sword, and Elrond reacts as Isildur walks away. Strider watches Boromir in a gallery, drawn to a fresco of Isildur defeating Sauron. Boromir looks at Narsil, the broken blade, and senses Strider's presence. Night falls on Rivendell as Strider and Arwen stand on a stone bridge, the Evenstar shining. Arwen closes Strider's fingers around the jewel and kisses him. Elrond addresses a council with Frodo, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and others. Frodo steps forward, places the ring on a stone plinth, and returns to his seat. Strider remains silent as Boromir turns away, then sharply as Legolas stands and Frodo looks at Strider questioningly.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Frodo sits up, looking at Gandalf questioningly. Saruman stands over Gandalf, gloating, and uses his staff to raise Gandalf, then sends him crashing down. Gandalf suddenly leaps up and throws himself off the tower, flying away on a giant eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle carries Gandalf over the mountains. Frodo, awake, sees Sam run to him joyfully. Sam smiles at a figure on a bench, and Frodo turns to see Bilbo, grinning and embracing him. Bilbo has aged. Frodo examines a red leather journal with maps and drawings, sitting with Bilbo on a terrace. Sam packs his full bag, startled. Gandalf and Elrond watch Frodo and Sam from a balcony. Isildur slices off Sauron's finger with a broken sword. Strider watches Boromir in a gallery, drawn to a fresco of Isildur defeating Sauron. Boromir looks at Narsil, sensing Strider's presence. Night falls on Rivendell as Strider and Arwen stand on a bridge. Arwen gives Strider the Evenstar and kisses him. Elrond addresses a council with Frodo, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and others. Frodo places the ring on a plinth and returns to his seat. Strider remains silent as Boromir turns away, and Legolas stands.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
He offers a warm smile to Frodo, who is just beginning to sit up, his expression filled with questions and a sense of unease, his eyes wandering away in thought. Nearby, Saruman stands triumphantly over Gandalf, exuding a sense of superiority. With the commanding power of his staff, Saruman lifts Gandalf from the ground, only to send him crashing back down with force. In a sudden burst of action, Gandalf lurches to his feet and makes a daring leap off the tower. Saruman watches intently as Gandalf, now free, flies away from the confines of Isengard on the back of a magnificent, giant eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle soars with grace and majesty over the towering mountains, carrying Gandalf towards the promise of a new dawn. 

Frodo raises himself up further, casting a look at Gandalf, while Sam rushes eagerly to Frodo's bedside, filled with joy and relief to see Frodo awake. Sam's gaze shifts past Frodo, landing on a solitary, bent figure sitting quietly on a sunlit bench. Frodo turns his head, following Sam's line of sight to see Bilbo Baggins, and breaks into a wide, joyful grin as he rushes forward to embrace him warmly. Bilbo, noticeably aged since he was last seen, greets Frodo with affection. 

Frodo carefully turns the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather-bound journal, his eyes scanning page after page filled with beautiful handwriting, intricate maps, and detailed drawings. He is seated with Frodo on a terrace that offers a breathtaking view of a cascading waterfall. As Frodo turns another page, he discovers a map of the Shire, and Bilbo smiles with pride. Meanwhile, Sam is busily attempting to cram more items into his already overflowing pack, which includes pots, pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, and clothes, before he looks up, startled by something. 

Gandalf and Elrond stand together, observing Frodo and Sam from the vantage point of Elrond's balcony. After a moment, Elrond turns and walks away, while Gandalf remains, gazing thoughtfully out the window. In a different scene, with the broken sword, Isildur slices off Sauron's finger, prompting a reaction from Elrond as Isildur turns and walks away. Strider watches from the shadows as Boromir strolls through the dimly lit gallery, his attention captured by an ancient fresco on the wall that depicts Isildur's victory over Sauron. Boromir gazes with wonder at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, resting on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing Strider's presence, he looks from the blade to Strider, as if perceiving a connection between them.

As night descends upon the serene and beautiful valley of Rivendell, enveloping it in stillness and quiet, Strider and Arwen stand together on a stone bridge. The Evenstar, resting at Arwen's breast, shines softly in the moonlight. Arwen gazes deeply into Strider's eyes, gently closes his fingers around the jewel, and leans in to kiss him tenderly. Meanwhile, Elrond addresses the council, where Frodo sits among a gathering of the free peoples of Middle-earth, including Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and twenty other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo steps forward with determination, moves towards a stone plinth, places the ring upon it, and then returns to his seat. Strider remains silent as Boromir turns away dismissively, then reacts sharply as Legolas stands, and Frodo looks at Strider with a questioning gaze.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
He bestows a warm and friendly smile upon Frodo, who is just beginning to sit up, his face etched with questions and a palpable sense of unease, while his wide eyes wander away, lost in thought. Nearby, Saruman stands with a triumphant air over Gandalf, exuding an unmistakable aura of superiority. With the commanding authority of his staff, Saruman effortlessly lifts Gandalf from the ground, only to send him crashing back down with formidable force. In an unexpected burst of action, Gandalf quickly lurches to his feet and makes a daring and bold leap off the tower. Saruman watches intently, his gaze fixed as Gandalf, now liberated, flies away from the confining walls of Isengard on the back of a magnificent and giant eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle soars with grace and majestic beauty over the towering peaks of the mountains, carrying Gandalf towards the hopeful promise of a new dawn and a fresh beginning. 

Frodo raises himself up further, casting a thoughtful look at Gandalf, while Sam rushes eagerly to Frodo's bedside, his face filled with an overwhelming sense of joy and immense relief to see Frodo awake and alert. Sam's gaze shifts past Frodo, landing on a solitary, bent figure sitting quietly and contemplatively on a sunlit bench. Frodo turns his head, following the direction of Sam's line of sight, to see the beloved Bilbo Baggins, and he breaks into a wide, joyful grin as he rushes forward to embrace him warmly and affectionately. Bilbo, noticeably aged and changed since he was last seen, greets Frodo with unreserved affection.

Frodo carefully turns the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather-bound journal, his eyes scanning page after page filled with beautiful handwriting, intricate maps, and detailed drawings that capture his attention. He is seated with Frodo on a terrace that offers a breathtaking and panoramic view of a cascading waterfall. As Frodo turns another page, he discovers a map of the Shire, and Bilbo smiles with pride and satisfaction. Meanwhile, Sam is busily attempting to cram more items into his already overflowing pack, which is filled with pots, pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, and clothes, before he is suddenly startled and looks up.

Gandalf and Elrond stand together, observing Frodo and Sam from the vantage point of Elrond's elegant balcony. After a moment, Elrond turns and walks away with purpose, while Gandalf remains, gazing thoughtfully out of the window with a contemplative expression. In a different scene, with the broken sword, Isildur slices off Sauron's finger, prompting a significant reaction from Elrond as Isildur turns and walks away decisively. Strider watches from the shadows as Boromir strolls through the dimly lit gallery, his attention captured by an ancient fresco on the wall that depicts the significant victory of Isildur over Sauron. Boromir gazes with a sense of wonder at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, resting solemnly on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing Strider's presence, he looks from the blade to Strider, as if perceiving a meaningful connection between them.

As night gracefully descends upon the serene and beautiful valley of Rivendell, enveloping it in a soothing stillness and quiet, Strider and Arwen stand together on a stone bridge. The Evenstar, resting gently at Arwen's breast, shines softly in the tranquil moonlight. Arwen gazes deeply into Strider's eyes, gently closes his fingers around the precious jewel, and leans in to kiss him tenderly. Meanwhile, Elrond addresses the council, where Frodo sits among a gathering of the free peoples of Middle-earth, including Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and twenty other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo steps forward with determination and confidence, moves towards a stone plinth, places the ring upon it, and then returns to his seat. Strider remains silent as Boromir turns away dismissively, then reacts sharply as Legolas stands, and Frodo looks at Strider with an expression full of questions and uncertainty.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He smiles warmly at Frodo, who is just beginning to sit up, his expression filled with questions and a hint of trouble, as his eyes slowly drift away from Gandalf. Meanwhile, Saruman stands over Gandalf, exuding a sense of triumph. With a commanding gesture, Saruman uses the power of his staff to lift Gandalf from the ground, only to send him crashing back down with force. In a sudden burst of energy, Gandalf lurches to his feet and, with a determined leap, throws himself off the tower. Saruman watches intently as Gandalf, now astride the back of a giant eagle, flies away from Isengard. Gwaihir the Eagle carries Gandalf with majestic grace over the mountains, heading towards the dawn. Frodo, now more alert, raises himself up and looks at Gandalf, while Sam rushes eagerly to Frodo's bedside, his face lighting up with joy at seeing Frodo awake. Sam's gaze shifts past Frodo, landing on a bent figure sitting alone on a bench, basking in the sunlight. Frodo follows Sam's gaze and, upon recognizing Bilbo Baggins, breaks into a broad grin and rushes forward to embrace him. Noticing the significant aging in Bilbo since they last met, Frodo turns his attention to a red leather-bound journal, its title page neatly inscribed. He carefully turns page after page, admiring the beautiful handwriting, intricate maps, and detailed drawings. They sit together on a terrace that overlooks a cascading waterfall. As Frodo turns another page, he discovers a map of the Shire, prompting Bilbo to smile with pride. Meanwhile, Sam is busily trying to cram more items into his already overflowing pack, including pots, pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, and clothes, before looking up, startled. Gandalf and Elrond stand on Elrond's balcony, observing Frodo and Sam, until Elrond turns to walk away, leaving Gandalf to gaze thoughtfully out the window. In a different scene, Isildur, wielding the broken sword, slices off Sauron's finger, causing Elrond to react as Isildur turns and walks away. Strider, hidden in the shadows, watches as Boromir strolls through the dimly lit gallery, his attention captured by an old fresco depicting Isildur's victory over Sauron. Boromir gazes with wonder at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, resting on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing Strider's presence, he looks from the blade to Strider, as if perceiving a connection. As night descends upon the serene valley of Rivendell, Strider and Arwen stand together on a stone bridge, the Evenstar at Arwen's breast glowing softly in the moonlight. Arwen gazes deeply into Strider's eyes, gently closes his fingers around the jewel, and leans in to kiss him tenderly. Elrond addresses the council, where Frodo sits among the free peoples of Middle-earth, including Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and twenty other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo steps forward with resolve, approaches a stone plinth, places the ring upon it, and then returns to his seat. Strider remains silent as Boromir turns away dismissively, only to react sharply when Legolas stands, prompting Frodo to look at Strider with a questioning expression.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Gandalf smiles at Frodo, who sits up with a questioning and troubled look. Saruman, standing over Gandalf, uses his staff to lift and then slam Gandalf to the ground. Gandalf suddenly rises and leaps off the tower, flying away from Isengard on the back of Gwaihir the Eagle, who carries him over the mountains toward the dawn. Frodo, now awake, is greeted joyfully by Sam, who notices Bilbo sitting alone in the sun. Frodo follows Sam's gaze, grins broadly, and rushes to embrace Bilbo, who has aged significantly. Later, Frodo sits with Bilbo on a terrace overlooking a waterfall, turning the pages of a red leather journal filled with beautiful handwriting, maps, and drawings, including a map of the Shire, as Bilbo smiles proudly. Meanwhile, Sam struggles to pack his belongings, startled as he looks up. Gandalf and Elrond observe Frodo and Sam from a balcony before Elrond departs and Gandalf gazes out the window. In a flashback, Isildur uses the broken sword to slice off Sauron's finger, with Elrond reacting as Isildur walks away. Strider watches Boromir in a dark gallery, where Boromir is captivated by a fresco of Isildur defeating Sauron and the broken blade of Elendil. Sensing Strider's presence, Boromir looks from the blade to Strider, feeling a connection. As night falls over Rivendell, Strider and Arwen stand on a stone bridge, where Arwen gives Strider the Evenstar and kisses him gently. At the council, Elrond addresses the assembly of Middle-earth's free peoples, including Frodo, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and others. Frodo steps forward, places the ring on a stone plinth, and returns to his seat, while Strider remains silent as Boromir reacts dismissively, and Legolas stands, prompting Frodo to look at Strider questioningly.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He smiles at Frodo, who is part of the small group of hobbits from the Shire embarked on an extraordinary adventure, as Frodo sits up, looking at Gandalf questioningly, troubled, and his eyes drift away. Saruman, the white wizard who has fallen under the sway of dark powers, stands over Gandalf, gloating. With the power of his staff, crafted from ancient wood and imbued with magic, Saruman raises Gandalf from the ground, then sends him crashing to the floor, exerting his dominance. Suddenly, Gandalf lurches to his feet and throws himself off the tower, a daring escape from the stronghold of Orthanc in Isengard. Saruman watches Gandalf fly away from Isengard on the back of a giant eagle, one of the majestic creatures known as the Eagles of Manwë, sent by the Valar to aid him. Gwaihir the Eagle, the lord of his kind, soars majestically over the Misty Mountains, carrying Gandalf towards the dawn and a new chapter of hope. Frodo raises himself up and looks at Gandalf as Sam, his loyal friend and gardener, runs to Frodo's bedside, overjoyed to find Frodo awake. Sam looks past Frodo smiling at a bent figure sitting alone on a bench in the sun. Frodo turns, following Sam's gaze to Bilbo Baggins, his beloved uncle and the original Ring-bearer, breaking into a broad grin as Frodo rushes forward to embrace him. Bilbo has aged significantly since last seen, his years extended by the Ring's influence but now catching up with him rapidly. Frodo turns the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather bound journal, Bilbo's book chronicling his adventures and the history of the Ring, looking at page after page of beautiful handwriting, with intricate maps and drawings. He is sitting with Frodo on a terrace overlooking a waterfall, one of the many natural wonders of Rivendell. Frodo turns a page and finds a map of the Shire, their peaceful homeland, as Bilbo smiles proudly. Sam busily tries to stuff more things into his already full pack, pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes, preparing for their imminent journey, and then looks up, startled. Gandalf and Elrond, the wise half-elven lord of Rivendell, watch Frodo and Sam from Elrond's balcony before Elrond turns and walks away and Gandalf turns to look out the window, contemplating the perilous task ahead. With the broken sword, Isildur slices off Sauron's finger, severing the One Ring and ending the dark lord's reign temporarily, as Elrond reacts and Isildur turns and walks away, inadvertently setting in motion events that would reshape Middle-earth. Strider, also known as Aragorn and the heir to Isildur, watches from the shadows as Boromir, the proud man from Gondor, strolls through the darkened gallery, his eyes drawn to an old fresco on the wall depicting Isildur defeating Sauron. Boromir looks with wonderment at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, Aragorn's ancestor, lying on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing Strider's presence, looks from the blade to Strider, as if sensing a connection to the lineage and the destiny intertwined with the sword. Night falls upon the beautiful valley of Rivendell, still and quiet, as Strider and Arwen, Elrond's daughter and the Evenstar of her people, stand upon a stone bridge, the Evenstar at Arwen's breast shining in the moonlight, a symbol of her love and commitment. Arwen looks into Strider's eyes, closes Strider's fingers around the jewel, and leans towards him, gently kissing him, sealing a promise of future unity between elves and men. Elrond addresses the council where Frodo, bearing the heavy burden of the One Ring, sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middle-earth, with Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, a prince of the Woodland Realm, and 20 other elves, dwarves, and men debating the fate of the world. Frodo steps forward, moves towards a stone plinth, places the ring on the plinth, marking the beginning of an important decision, and returns to his seat. Strider says nothing as Boromir turns away dismissively, then sharply as Legolas stands and Frodo looks at Strider questioningly, seeking reassurance.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: He smiles at Frodo as Frodo sits up looking at Gandalf questioningly troubled and his eyes drift away. Saruman stands over Gandalf gloating. With the power of his staff Saruman raises Gandalf from the ground then sends him crashing to the floor. Suddenly Gandalf lurches to his feet and throws himself off the tower. Saruman watches Gandalf fly away from Isengard on the back of a giant eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle soars majestically over the mountains carrying Gandalf towards the dawn. Frodo raises himself up and looks at Gandalf as Sam runs to Frodo's bedside overjoyed to find Frodo awake. Sam looks past Frodo smiling at a bent figure sitting alone on a bench in the sun. Frodo turns following Sam's gaze to Bilbo Baggins breaking into a broad grin as Frodo rushes forward to embrace him. Bilbo has aged significantly since last seen. Frodo turns the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather bound journal looking at page after page of beautiful handwriting with intricate maps and drawings. He is sitting with Frodo on a terrace overlooking a waterfall. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Frodo turns a page and finds a map of the Shire as Bilbo smiles proudly. Sam busily tries to stuff more things into his already full pack pots and pans blankets cooking utensils provisions clothes and then looks up startled. Gandalf and Elrond watch Frodo and Sam from Elrond's balcony before Elrond turns and walks away and Gandalf turns to look out the window. With the broken sword Isildur slices off Sauron's finger as Elrond reacts and Isildur turns and walks away. Strider watches from the shadows as Boromir strolls through the darkened gallery his eyes drawn to an old fresco on the wall depicting Isildur defeating Sauron. Boromir looks with wonderment at Narsil the broken blade of Elendil lying on a clothcovered plinth and sensing Strider's presence looks from the blade to Strider as if sensing a connection. Night falls upon the beautiful valley of Rivendell still and quiet as Strider and Arwen stand upon a stone bridge. the Evenstar at Arwen's breast shining in the moonlight. Arwen looks into Strider's eyes closes Strider's fingers around the jewel and leans towards him gently kissing him. Elrond addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middleearth with Elrond Gandalf Strider Legolas and 20 other elves dwarves and men. Frodo steps forward moves towards a stone plinth places the ring on the plinth and returns to his seat. Strider says nothing as Boromir turns away dismissively. then sharply as Legolas stands and Frodo looks at Strider questioningly.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The dog smiles at Frodo as Frodo sits up, looking at the turtle questioningly, troubled, and his eyes drift away. The dragon stands over the turtle, gloating. With the power of his staff, the dragon raises the turtle from the ground, then sends him crashing to the floor. Suddenly, the turtle lurches to his feet and throws himself off the tower. The dragon watches the turtle fly away from Isengard on the back of a giant eagle. The butterfly soars majestically over the mountains, carrying the turtle towards the dawn. Frodo raises himself up and looks at the turtle as the rabbit runs to Frodo's bedside, overjoyed to find Frodo awake. The rabbit looks past Frodo smiling at a bent figure sitting alone on a bench in the sun. Frodo turns, following the rabbit's gaze to the ghost, breaking into a broad grin as Frodo rushes forward to embrace him. The ghost has aged significantly since last seen. Frodo turns the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather bound journal, looking at page after page of beautiful handwriting, with intricate maps and drawings. The squirrel is sitting with Frodo on a terrace overlooking a waterfall. Frodo turns a page and finds a map of the Shire, as the ghost smiles proudly. The rabbit busily tries to stuff more things into his already full pack, pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes, and then looks up, startled. The owl and the fox watch Frodo and the rabbit from the fox's balcony before the fox turns and walks away and the owl turns to look out the window. With the broken sword, the alien slices off Sauron's finger as the fox reacts and the alien turns and walks away. The cat watches from the shadows as the bear strolls through the darkened gallery, his eyes drawn to an old fresco on the wall depicting the alien defeating Sauron. The bear looks with wonderment at Narsil, the broken blade of Elendil, lying on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing the cat's presence, looks from the blade to the cat, as if sensing a connection. Night falls upon the beautiful valley of Rivendell, still and quiet, as the cat and the mermaid stand upon a stone bridge, the Evenstar at the mermaid's breast shining in the moonlight. The mermaid looks into the cat's eyes, closes the cat's fingers around the jewel, and leans towards him, gently kissing him. The fox addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middle-earth, with the fox, the owl, the cat, Legolas, and 20 other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo steps forward, moves towards a stone plinth, places the ring on the plinth, and returns to his seat. The cat says nothing as the bear turns away dismissively, then sharply as Legolas stands and Frodo looks at the cat questioningly.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He smiles at Frodo as Frodo sits up, looking at Gandalf questioningly, troubled, and his eyes drift away. Saruman stands over Gandalf, gloating. With the power of his wand, Saruman raises Gandalf from the floor, then sends him crashing to the ground. Suddenly, Gandalf lurches to his feet and throws himself off the cliff. Saruman watches Gandalf fly away from the castle on the back of a giant dragonfly. Gwaihir the Dragonfly soars majestically over the forests, carrying Gandalf towards the sunset. Frodo raises himself up and looks at Gandalf as Sam runs to Frodo's hammock, overjoyed to find Frodo awake. Sam looks past Frodo smiling at a bent figure sitting alone on a log in the shade. Frodo turns, following Sam's gaze to Bilbo Baggins, breaking into a broad grin as Frodo rushes forward to embrace him. Bilbo has aged significantly since last seen. Frodo turns the neatly inscribed title page of a blue cloth-bound journal, looking at page after page of beautiful handwriting, with intricate charts and sketches. He is sitting with Frodo on a porch overlooking a river. Frodo turns a page and finds a map of the Woodland, as Bilbo smiles proudly. Sam busily tries to stuff more things into his already full basket, hats and scarves, pillows, fishing rods, provisions, shoes, and then looks up, startled. Gandalf and Elrond watch Frodo and Sam from Elrond's balcony before Elrond turns and walks away and Gandalf turns to look out the window. With the broken dagger, Isildur slices off Sauron's toe as Elrond reacts and Isildur turns and walks away. Strider watches from the shadows as Boromir strolls through the darkened corridor, his eyes drawn to an old tapestry on the wall depicting Isildur defeating Sauron. Boromir looks with wonderment at Narsil, the broken handle of Elendil, lying on a velvet-covered pedestal, and sensing Strider's presence, looks from the handle to Strider, as if sensing a connection. Night falls upon the beautiful meadow of Rivendell, still and quiet, as Strider and Arwen stand upon a wooden bridge, the Evenstar at Arwen's wrist shining in the moonlight. Arwen looks into Strider's eyes, closes Strider's fingers around the pendant, and leans towards him, gently kissing him. Elrond addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free creatures of Middle-earth, with Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and 20 other goblins, trolls, and men. Frodo steps forward, moves towards a wooden pedestal, places the crown on the pedestal, and returns to his seat. Strider says nothing as Boromir turns away dismissively, then sharply as Legolas stands and Frodo looks at Strider questioningly.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He laughs at Frodo as Frodo lies back, gazing at Gandalf inquisitively, perplexed, and his eyes wander away. Saruman hovers over Gandalf, boasting. With the power of his staff, Saruman lifts Gandalf from the ground, then sends him soaring into the air. Suddenly, Gandalf springs to his feet and hurls himself off the tower. Saruman observes Gandalf float away from Isengard on the back of a giant eagle. Gwaihir the Eagle glides smoothly over the mountains, transporting Gandalf towards the dawn. Frodo stretches himself up and stares at Gandalf as Sam races to Frodo's bedside, thrilled to find Frodo awake. Sam glances past Frodo grinning at a crouched figure sitting alone on a bench in the sun. Frodo turns, following Sam's gaze to Bilbo Baggins, beaming as Frodo dashes forward to clasp him. Bilbo has withered considerably since last seen. Frodo flips the neatly inscribed title page of a red leather bound journal, examining page after page of elegant handwriting, with intricate maps and drawings. He is sitting with Frodo on a terrace overlooking a waterfall. Frodo flips a page and uncovers a map of the Shire, as Bilbo nods proudly. Sam frantically attempts to cram more things into his already full pack, pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes, and then glances up, amazed. Gandalf and Elrond observe Frodo and Sam from Elrond's balcony before Elrond turns and strolls away and Gandalf turns to gaze out the window. With the broken sword, Isildur severs Sauron's finger as Elrond flinches and Isildur turns and strides away. Strider observes from the shadows as Boromir ambles through the dim gallery, his eyes captivated by an old fresco on the wall depicting Isildur vanquishing Sauron. Boromir gazes with fascination at Narsil, the shattered blade of Elendil, resting on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing Strider’s presence, shifts his gaze from the blade to Strider, as if feeling a connection. Night descends upon the beautiful valley of Rivendell, tranquil and still, as Strider and Arwen linger upon a stone bridge, the Evenstar at Arwen's breast glimmering in the moonlight. Arwen stares into Strider's eyes, folds Strider's fingers around the jewel, and leans towards him, softly pecking him. Elrond addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middle-earth, with Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and 20 other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo advances, approaches a stone plinth, places the ring on the plinth, and returns to his seat. Strider remains silent as Boromir pivots away disapprovingly, then abruptly as Legolas rises and Frodo glances at Strider inquisitively.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The lamppost grins at the toaster as the toaster sits up, looking at the chandelier questioningly, troubled, and its eyes drift away. The fountain stands over the chandelier, gloating. With the power of its hat, the fountain raises the chandelier from the ground, then sends it crashing to the floor. Suddenly, the chandelier lurches to its feet and throws itself off the skyscraper. The fountain watches the chandelier fly away from the library on the back of a giant balloon. The kite soars majestically over the mountains, carrying the chandelier towards the dawn. The toaster raises itself up and looks at the chandelier as the penguin runs to the toaster's bedside, overjoyed to find the toaster awake. The penguin looks past the toaster smiling at a bent streetlamp sitting alone on a bench in the sun. The toaster turns, following the penguin's gaze to the grandfather clock, breaking into a broad grin as the toaster rushes forward to embrace it. The grandfather clock has aged significantly since last seen. The toaster turns the neatly inscribed title page of a blue velvet-bound cookbook, looking at page after page of beautiful scribbling, with intricate maps and drawings. It is sitting with the toaster on a terrace overlooking a waterfall. The toaster turns a page and finds a map of the zoo, as the grandfather clock smiles proudly. The penguin busily tries to stuff more objects into its already full suitcase, pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes, and then looks up, startled. The chandelier and the violin watch the toaster and the penguin from the violin's balcony before the violin turns and walks away and the chandelier turns to look out the window. With the broken axe, the postman slices off the dragon's finger as the violin reacts and the postman turns and walks away. The lumberjack watches from the shadows as the musician strolls through the darkened gallery, its eyes drawn to an old fresco on the wall depicting the postman defeating the dragon. The musician looks with wonderment at the flute, the broken bow of the fiddler, lying on a cloth-covered plinth, and sensing the lumberjack's presence, looks from the bow to the lumberjack, as if sensing a connection. Night falls upon the beautiful valley of the orchard, still and quiet, as the lumberjack and the dancer stand upon a stone archway, the Nightingale at the dancer's hat shining in the moonlight. The dancer looks into the lumberjack's eyes, closes the lumberjack's fingers around the pebble, and leans towards it, gently kissing it. The violin addresses the gathering where the toaster sits amongst a gathering of free peoples of Neverland, with the violin, the chandelier, the lumberjack, the mechanic, and 20 other painters, bakers, and poets. The toaster steps forward, moves towards a stone pedestal, places the key on the pedestal, and returns to its seat. The lumberjack says nothing as the musician turns away dismissively, then sharply as the mechanic stands and the toaster looks at the lumberjack questioningly.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She frowns at Samwise as Samwise lies down, squinting at Aragorn curiously, puzzled, and her gaze shifts away. Wormtongue hovers over Aragorn, sneering. With the twist of his cloak, Wormtongue lowers Aragorn onto the ground, then lifts him into the air. Suddenly, Aragorn springs to his knees and hurls himself off the cliff. Wormtongue observes Aragorn glide away from Mordor on the wings of a massive moth. Landroval the Moth flutters gracefully over the valleys, bearing Aragorn towards the sunset. Samwise pushes herself up and squints at Aragorn as Pippin strolls to Samwise's side, delighted to find Samwise alert. Pippin gazes beyond Samwise chuckling at a tall figure lounging alone under a tree in the shade. Samwise wheels around, tailing Pippin's gaze to Merry Brandybuck, breaking into a soft smile as Samwise hops forward to greet him. Merry has matured considerably since last noticed. Samwise flips the hastily scribbled title page of a blue velvet-bound manuscript, skimming through page after page of elegant penmanship, with elaborate charts and illustrations. She is lounging with Samwise beneath a pergola overlooking a ravine. Samwise flips another page and discovers a chart of Gondor, as Merry beams contentedly. Pippin busily attempts to cram fewer items into his already stuffed sack, shoes and hats, scarves, eating utensils, rations, books, and then glances around, bewildered. Aragorn and Galadriel observe Samwise and Pippin from Galadriel's terrace before Galadriel pivots and strides towards them and Aragorn shifts to peer through the archway. With the repaired dagger, Elros carves off Morgoth's wing as Galadriel winces and Elros pivots and strides towards them. Glorfindel listens from the foothills as Gimli ambles through the dim chamber, his sights attracted to a new mosaic on the ceiling illustrating Elros vanquishing Morgoth. Gimli peers with admiration at Glamdring, the intact sword of Gil-galad, resting on a velveted pedestal, and noticing Glorfindel's aura, peers from the sword to Glorfindel, as if sensing a kinship. Daybreak descends upon the serene forest of Lorien, calm and hushed, as Glorfindel and Eowyn stand upon a wooden pier, the Star of Earendil at Eowyn's neck glowing in the starlight. Eowyn peers into Glorfindel's eyes, wraps Glorfindel's arms around the necklace, and leans away from him, softly whispering to him. Galadriel addresses the gathering where Samwise sits amongst a conclave of allied creatures of Arda, with Galadriel, Aragorn, Glorfindel, Gimli, and 15 other hobbits, ents, and a wizard. Samwise edges backward, retreats from a wooden pedestal, places the stone on the floor, and bounds to her spot. Glorfindel mutters something as Gimli glances over dismissively, then suddenly as Gimli sits and Samwise glances at Glorfindel thoughtfully.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He grins at Frodo as Frodo springs up, gazing at Gandalf curiously, perplexed, and his gaze wanders off. Saruman looms over Gandalf, smiling smugly. With the force of his wand, Saruman lifts Gandalf from the floor, then sends him tumbling to the ceiling. Suddenly, Gandalf leaps to his feet and launches himself off the staircase. Saruman observes Gandalf float away from Isengard on the back of a colossal dragonfly. Gwaihir the Dragonfly glides gracefully over the canyons, carrying Gandalf towards the dusk. Frodo elevates himself up and glances at Gandalf as Sam dashes to Frodo's side, thrilled to find Frodo alert. Sam peers beyond Frodo grinning at a hunched silhouette resting alone on a hammock in the shade. Frodo swivels, trailing Sam's gaze to Bilbo Baggins, breaking into a wide smile as Frodo runs forward to greet him. Bilbo has matured considerably since last seen. Frodo flips the neatly engraved cover of a blue cloth-bound scroll, examining sheet after sheet of exquisite calligraphy, with detailed charts and sketches. He is reclining with Frodo on a veranda overlooking a fountain. Frodo flips a sheet and discovers a chart of the Shire, as Bilbo beams happily. Sam frantically attempts to cram more items into his already crammed satchel, cups and pails, linens, baking tools, rations, garments, and then glances up, surprised. Gandalf and Elrond observe Frodo and Sam from Elrond's porch before Elrond spins and strides away and Gandalf turns to peer out the door. With the shattered spear, Isildur chops off Sauron's toe as Elrond flinches and Isildur spins and strides off. Strider peers from the nooks as Boromir saunters through the dimly lit corridor, his gaze drawn to an ancient tapestry on the ceiling depicting Isildur vanquishing Sauron. Boromir gazes with amazement at Narsil, the fractured spear of Elendil, resting on a silk-covered dais, and sensing Strider's presence, looks from the spear to Strider, as if sensing a link. Dusk descends upon the stunning canyon of Rivendell, serene and silent, as Strider and Arwen stand upon a wooden pier, the Evenstar at Arwen's waist glowing in the starlight. Arwen gazes into Strider's eyes, places Strider's hands around the crystal, and leans towards him, softly hugging him. Elrond speaks to the assembly where Frodo reclines among a gathering of free beings of Middle-earth, with Elrond, Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and 20 other elves, dwarves, and men. Frodo stands forward, proceeds towards a wooden dais, sets the cup on the dais, and retreats to his spot. Strider says nothing as Boromir turns aside indifferently, then abruptly as Legolas rises and Frodo glances at Strider inquisitively.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She grins at Nimbus as Nimbus reclines over, staring at Fizzle curiously, anxious, and her vision wanders elsewhere. Teragon looms above Fizzle, smirking. With the force of his spear, Teragon elevates Fizzle from the earth, then flings her stumbling to the carpet. Abruptly, Fizzle staggers to his toes and hurls himself off the spire. Teragon observes Fizzle glide away from Cairncrest on the wings of a massive phoenix. Aetheria the Phoenix glides gracefully over the forest, bearing Fizzle towards the twilight. Nimbus hoists himself up and glances at Fizzle as Pip dashes to Nimbus's cot, delighted to discover Nimbus alert. Pip gazes beyond Nimbus chuckling at a hunched silhouette resting alone on a stool in the shade. Nimbus swivels, trailing Pip's stare to Pippin Tuggles, bursting into a wide beam as Nimbus scampers forward to hug him. Pippin has become notably elder since last encountered. Nimbus flips the meticulously marked cover sheet of a blue velvet bound scroll, scanning sheet after sheet of exquisite lettering, with detailed charts and sketches. She is reclining with Nimbus on a veranda surveying a pond. Nimbus flips a sheet and discovers a diagram of the Moors, as Pippin beams warmly. Pip frantically attempts to cram more items into her already brimming sack, kettles and skillets, duvets, culinary tools, rations, apparel, and then peers up, astonished. Fizzle and Elm gaze at Nimbus and Pip from Elm's porch before Elm spins and strides away and Fizzle gazes out the portal. With the fractured dagger, Avar wrenches off Mortas's thumb as Elm responds and Avar spins and strides away. Rover observes from the veils as Garin ambles through the dimmed hallway, his gaze drawn to an ancient mural on the partition illustrating Avar overcoming Mortas. Garin peers with awe at Shardsil, the shattered scimitar of Highwind, reclining on a fabric-draped pedestal, and perceiving Rover's aura, glances from the scimitar to Rover, as if feeling a link. Twilight engulfs the splendid hollow of Shadowvale, calm and silent, as Rover and Lira stand upon a wooden footbridge, the Starlight at Lira's necklace gleaming in the starlight. Lira gazes into Rover's gaze, curls Rover's digits around the gem, and inclines towards him, softly pecking him. Elm addresses the committee where Nimbus reclines amongst a committee of liberated tribes of Abyssland, with Elm, Fizzle, Rover, Orion, and 30 other sprites, giants, and humans. Nimbus edges forward, progresses towards a granite pedestal, sets the amulet on the pedestal, and retreats to her perch. Rover utters nothing as Garin pivots away dismissively, then briskly as Orion rises and Nimbus peers at Rover inquisitively.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Gandalf smiles at Frodo, who looks troubled. Saruman confronts Gandalf, using his staff to lift and then slam him down. Gandalf escapes by jumping off the tower and flying away on an eagle. Frodo, now awake, is greeted by Sam, who is overjoyed. They spot Bilbo, who has aged, and Frodo embraces him warmly. Frodo examines Bilbo's journal filled with maps and drawings. Sam is busy packing, while Gandalf and Elrond observe Frodo and Sam. In Elrond's balcony, Isildur's defeat of Sauron is depicted, and Strider watches Boromir as he admires Narsil, the broken blade. At night, in Rivendell, Arwen gives Strider the Evenstar, and they share a kiss. During a council meeting, Frodo places the ring on a stone plinth, as Strider remains silent and Boromir turns away dismissively when Legolas stands and Frodo looks at Strider with curiosity.

plinth places the ring on the plinth and returns to his seat  Elrond addresses the council where Frodo sits amongst a council of free peoples of Middleearth with Elrond Gandalf Strider Legolas and 20 eyes drift away
